summary:
Absolute monarchy is when a king or queen has all the power and no one can tell them what to do. This was popular in Europe a long time ago, especially during the 1600s. Kings like Louis XIV in France had absolute power. In England, King Charles I tried to rule this way, but it led to a big war.

Over time, people started to want governments where the power comes from the people. Now, only a few places still have absolute monarchies, like Brunei and Saudi Arabia. Most countries have constitutional monarchies, where the king or queen has less power and works with others to rule.
title: Absolute monarchy
